page.title: 16Rossett Mill
page.content:
The mill in Rossett is situated on the south bank of the river Alyn. The original mill was built before 1085 and was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. The mill today is cream and brown and has the typical look of a Tudor building. It was built in 1661.
The mill was used to grind wheat into flour. Flour would have been traded for goods which could not be grown.
The mill has been restored during the last ten years. It is constructed of bricks and oak beams. The windows are original and though cracked are still working. The mill is a tourist attraction to travellers through Rossett and it is hoped that it can be opened as a museum.
